# Random walks

## Simple random walk

$$
  {\boldsymbol u_{t+1}} = \but + \beps
$$

where

$$
  {\boldsymbol \varepsilon} = \text{Norm}(0, \sigma^2 {\bf I})
$$

## Simple random walk simulation {.smaller}

<!-- <br> -->

:::: {.columns}

<!-- <br> -->


::: {.column width="45%"}

<br>


```{r, echo=-1}
#| label: rw-simple
#| attr-source: 'style="font-size: 0.85em;"'
#| code-block-bg: true

set.seed(4887730)
sigma <- 0.05
T <- 50
u <- matrix(NA, nrow=T, ncol=2)
u[1,] <- c(0.5,0.5)
for(t in 2:T) {
  epsilon <- rnorm(n=2, mean=c(0,0), sd=sigma)
  u[t,] <- u[t-1,] + epsilon
  ## Equivalent to two lines above
  ## u[t,] <- rnorm(n=2, mean=u[t-1,], sd=0.05)  
}
```

## Biased random walk


\begin{equation}
  {\boldsymbol u_{t+1}} = \but + {\bf B}(\but-{\boldsymbol s}) + \beps
  \label{eq:brwalk}
\end{equation}

where, typically

$$
\begin{equation}
  {\bf B}	= 
  \begin{pmatrix}
    \rho & 0 \\
    0    & \rho
  \end{pmatrix}
\end{equation}
$$

with $\rho \in [0,1]$

## Biased random walk simulation


<!-- <br> -->

:::: {.columns}

<!-- <br> -->


::: {.column width="45%"}

<br>


```{r, echo=-1}
#| label: brw-simple
#| attr-source: 'style="font-size: 0.85em;"'

set.seed(4887730)
sigma <- 0.05
rho <- 0.1           # Bias towards activity center
T <- 50
u <- matrix(NA, nrow=T, ncol=2)
u[1,] <- c(0.5,0.5)
s <- c(0.5,0.5)
B <- diag(rho,2)
for(t in 2:T) {
  epsilon <- rnorm(n=2, mean=c(0,0), sd=sigma)
  u[t,] <- u[t-1,] + B%*%(s-u[t-1,]) + epsilon
}
```

<br>


```{r, echo=-(1:2)}
#| label: fig-brw-simple
#| attr-source: 'style="font-size: 0.85em;"'
#| fig-width: 7
#| fig-height: 7
#| fig.show: hide

##| output-location: column
par(mai=c(0.7,0.7,0.1,0.1))
plot(u, asp=1, xlim=c(0,1), ylim=c(0,1),
     xlab="", ylab="")
points(s[1], s[2], pch=16, col=rgb(0,0,1,0.5), cex=2.5)
arrows(u[1:49,1], u[1:49,2],
       u[2:50,1], u[2:50,2], length=0.1,
       col="blue")

```

## Correlated random walk

\begin{equation}
  \butp = \but + {\bf R}(\but-{\boldsymbol u}_{t-1}) + \beps
  \label{eq:crwalk}
\end{equation}

where

$$
  {\bf R} = \gamma
  \begin{pmatrix}
    \cos(\theta) & -\sin(\theta) \\
    \sin(\theta) & \cos(\theta) 
  \end{pmatrix}
$$
with $\theta \in [-\pi,\pi]$ being the expected turn angle, and
$\gamma \in [0,1]$ dampening the persistence. 



## Correlated random walk simulation


```{r, echo=-1}
#| label: fig-crw-simple
#| attr-source: 'style="font-size: 0.85em;"'
#| fig-width: 7
#| fig-height: 7
#| output-location: column

set.seed(4887730)
sigma <- 0.05
gamma <- 0.8      ## Damping of correlated walk
theta <- 0        ## Correlation (-pi,pi)
T <- 50
u <- matrix(NA, nrow=T, ncol=2)
u[1,] <- c(0.5,0.5)
u[2,] <- rnorm(2, u[1,], sd=0.05)
R <- gamma*matrix(c(cos(theta),sin(theta),-sin(theta),cos(theta)),
                  nrow=2, ncol=2)
for(t in 3:T) {
  epsilon <- rnorm(n=2, mean=c(0,0), sd=sigma)
  u[t,] <- u[t-1,] + R%*%(u[t-1,]-u[t-2,]) + epsilon
}
par(mai=c(0.7,0.7,0.1,0.1))
plot(u, asp=1, xlim=c(0,1), ylim=c(0,1),
     xlab="", ylab="")
arrows(u[1:49,1], u[1:49,2],
       u[2:50,1], u[2:50,2], length=0.1,
       col="blue")

```


## Random walks along environmental gradients


\begin{equation}
  \butp = \but + {\bf D}\nabla x(\but) + \beps
  \label{eq:erwalk}
\end{equation}
where $\bf D = \alpha {\bf I}$ is a $2\times2$ matrix describing the
effect of the gradient in the environment ($\nabla x$) at location
$\but$. 

Positive values of $\alpha$ describe the scenario in which the
organism tends to move in the direction of the gradient. If
$\alpha=0$, the individual will ignore the environment as it follows a
simple random walk.


## Environment

```{r}
set.seed(430)
library(terra)
delta <- 0.025                          ## Resolution
grid0 <- seq(delta/2, 1-delta/2, delta)    
grid <- cbind(rep(grid0, each=length(grid0)), rep(grid0, times=length(grid0)))
distmat <- as.matrix(dist(grid))        ## Distance b/w grid points
npixels <- nrow(distmat)
V <- exp(-0.1*distmat)                  ## Covariance
R <- chol(V)
X <- t(R) %*% rnorm(npixels)            ## Gaussian random field
Xr <- rasterFromXYZ(cbind(grid, X),     ## Convert to raster
    crs="+proj=utm +zone=17 +datum=NAD83 +units=m +no_defs +type=crs")
terr <- terrain(Xr, opt=c("slope","aspect"))  ## Slope and aspect
vfieldU <- terr$slope * sin(terr$aspect)      ## x-coord of arrow head
vfieldV <- terr$slope * cos(terr$aspect)      ## y-coord of arrow head
vfieldData <- cbind(as.data.frame(Xr, xy=TRUE), v1=values(vfieldU), v2=values(vfieldV))
names(vfieldData) <- c("s1","s2","X","v1","v2")
```
